sentences.sContent: A Quaker preacher, traveling in the more complaisant colony of Maryland, came upon a party of young people who were dancing merrily together.
sentences.sContent_eng: A Quaker preacher, traveling in the more complaisant colony of Maryland, came upon a party of young people who were dancing merrily together.
sentences.sCn: 一个贵格会的传道人，在更殷勤有礼的马里兰殖民地旅行时，遇到了一群年轻人在欢快的跳舞。

synos.tran: 彬彬有礼的；顺从的；殷勤的

remMethod.val: com + plais (取悦) + ant → 彬彬有礼的， 殷勤的

trans.tranCn: 彬彬有礼的， 殷勤的； 柔顺的
trans.tranOther: showing a desire to comply or oblige; polite
